title: 18F-AV-1451 PET Imaging in Professional Fighters
description_brief: Subjects enrolled in the Professional Fighters Brain Health Study (PFBHS) will receive flortaucipir to explore its use as a biomarker for brain injury related to repetitive head trauma and to examine the relationship between clinical presentation and tau deposition.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Five subjects enrolled in the study but did not receive a flortaucipir PET scan (2 active, 3 retired). Two additional subjects in the active fighters group did not have the minimum 10 fights required for inclusion into the study, and therefore were considered not to have completed the study. However, their PET scan results were analyzed.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Enrollment occurred between Feb 2015 and Feb 2017

groups.title: Active Professional Fighters
groups.description: Active professional fighters (with and without cognitive impairment) receiving a flortaucipir PET scan

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measures.title: Amyloid status
measures.description: Amyloid status determined by florbetapir PET scan
measures.populationDescription: Per protocol, baseline amyloid status was only obtained for fighters \> 50 years of age or with a clinical presentation that suggested a possible Alzheimer's disease diagnosis (n=15)

outcomeMeasures.title: Flortaucipir Imaging (Quantitative) Between Cognitive Groups
outcomeMeasures.description: Standard Uptake Value Ratio (SUVr) by subject enrollment group (cognitive impaired/normal) across weighted cortical average, frontal, temporal, parietal, and occipital brain regions. For SUVr, a value of 1 or lower signifies no flortaucipir activity above background, values greater than 1 signify increasing flortaucipir activity in the brain.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Cognitively impaired fighters either had subjective cognitive complaints or objective decline or impairment as determined by the investigator.

groups.title: Cognitively Impaired Fighters
groups.description: Fighters (active and retired) with cognitive impairment at baseline

groups.title: Cognitively Normal Fighters
groups.description: Fighters (active and retired) without cognitive impairment at baseline

outcomeMeasures.title: Flortaucipir Imaging (Quantitative) Between Fighter Groups
outcomeMeasures.description: Standard Uptake Value Ratio (SUVr) by subject enrollment group (active fighter/retired fighter) across weighted cortical average, frontal, temporal, parietal, and occipital brain regions. For SUVr, a value of 1 or lower signifies no flortaucipir activity above background, values greater than 1 signify increasing flortaucipir activity in the brain.

outcomeMeasures.description: Qualitative read results (no, mild, moderate, or intense uptake) compared between cognitively impaired (CI) and cognitively normal (CN) groups.

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: End of study for AE reporting was 48 hours after the last study drug administration.
adverseEventsModule.description: Adverse Events were defined as occurring or worsening after injection of dose, within 48 hours post injection. AEs occurring after flortaucipir administration, but outside that window were not recorded in the database, unless considered attributable to flortaucipir injection.

explanation_target: Reason: The described intervention is administration of flortaucipir (also called 18F‑AV‑1451 / T807), which is a PET radiotracer developed to bind aggregated tau (neurofibrillary tangles) for brain imaging, not a therapeutic agent. citeturn0search2turn0search9

Act: Flortaucipir is marketed as TAUVID (flortaucipir F‑18) and is FDA‑approved for PET imaging to estimate density/distribution of aggregated tau in adults being evaluated for Alzheimer’s disease — a diagnostic biomarker use rather than a disease‑modifying treatment. The TAUVID label specifically notes it is not indicated for evaluation of chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE). citeturn0search0turn0search1

Reflect: The trial description states flortaucipir will be used "to explore its use as a biomarker for brain injury related to repetitive head trauma and to examine the relationship between clinical presentation and tau deposition," i.e., an imaging/diagnostic biomarker study rather than an interventional therapeutic trial. Therefore the trial does not fit any of the four therapeutic categories (disease‑targeted biologic, disease‑targeted small molecule, cognitive enhancer, or neuropsychiatric symptom improvement) and is classified as 'N/A'. citeturn0search5turn0search4

Web search results / sources used: 1) Lilly press release and TAUVID prescribing info describing TAUVID (flortaucipir F‑18) and its indication/limitations. citeturn0search0turn0search1 2) NCATS / drug info page and Journal of Nuclear Medicine articles describing flortaucipir (18F‑AV‑1451 / T807) as a tau PET radiotracer (mechanism: binds paired helical filament tau). citeturn0search2turn0search9 3) PubMed / Brain / clinical literature on flortaucipir use in studies of tau and cognition. citeturn0search5turn0search6
